intro: Podolobium, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. These plants are native to various regions of Africa and are characterized by their showy, yellow or orange flowers. Podolobium species typically have compound leaves and produce pods that contain seeds. They are often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. The genus is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in nitrogen fixation and its potential for medicinal uses.
